Old bread: >>52387906

Welcome to the Raidcat / 6 Star Tera Raid Meta Thread

>lol I can solo 5 star raids I don't need your ugly cat
6 stars are infinitely harder than 5 and extremely annoying. You can do them the normal way and risk wasting your time, or accept the raidcat as your raid savior.

>What's the meta?
4 Perrserkers. Their Hidden Ability stacks multiplicatively and, if you follow the flowchart, you can one-shot most raids.

>What's the raidcat like?
Perrserker @ Lum Berry
Level 100
Ability: Steely Spirit (Hidden Ability)
EVs: 252 Atk / 252 Speed (Host) or HP (Joiner)
Adamant Nature
- Iron Head
- Screech
- Swords Dance
- Taunt (Host) / Helping Hand (Joiner)

>Host? Joiner? Flowchart?
There's a small difference in strategy whether you are hosting or joining a raid and a specific flowchart. See OP pic.

>Does this work every time?
No, but it's one of the only consistent strategies that you can follow. It's not great against Pokemon that have strong and/or STAB Fire/Fighting/Ground moves, and if their Tera resists Steel it can also take a few more turn (but still doable).

>So what's the hype?
Catraids are simple to organize, have plenty of flowcharts, and finish the job very quickly. It's about efficiency.

>I have a question about raids...
Check OP pic.

>How to get cat with HA?
Language Teacher sidequest, then use an Ability Patch to change its ability. Patch is an 11% drop from 6 Star Raids.

>I tried breeding but I'm getting Kantonian Meowth
Make the G-Meowth hold an Everstone

>wtf I did that but none of them have Steely Spirit
G-Meowth's HA is Unnerve, it becomes Steely Spirit upon evolution.

For other viable meta strategies and mons, Ctrl+F OTHERMONS

For specific strategies, Ctrl+F HARDRAIDS

Use this thread to trade for raidcats, to organize (raidcat) raids, or just to discuss and ask questions about raids in general.

Reading game's pokedex, documentation, bulbapedia, serebii and other credible scientfic sources I cannot find any data that backs up my theory, but I think there may be some kind of correlation between ancient and future pokemon with previous pokemon.

Some things that may back up my claim:

1) Koraidon/Miraidon are side to be past and future forms of Cyclizar (in the game)
2) The game points that Great Tusk and Iron Treads highly resembles a Donphan, and one of the characters in the last quest thinks Scream Tail is a Jigglypuff.
3) Most of the pokemon have a high resemblance to common pokemon, I'll list them:

Great Tusk, Iron Treads -> Donphan
Brute Bonnet -> Amoonguss
Sandy Shocks -> Magneton
Scream Tail -> Jigglypuff
Flutter Mane -> Misdreavous
Slither Wing, Iron Moth -> Maybe Volcarona
Roaring Moon -> Mega Salamence
Iron Hands - >Hariyama
Iron Jugulis -> Hydreigon
Iron Thorns -> Tyranitar
Iron Bundle -> Delibird
Iron Valiant -> Gallade

I know about the great dangers "pattern recognition" posseses, and I'm usually skeptic about conspiracy theories but these similarities seem to be too much for a coincidence.

threads.name: Anonymous
threads.com:
Welcome to the Raidcat / 6 Star Tera Raid Meta Thread

>lol I can solo 5 star raids I don't need your ugly cat
6 stars are infinitely harder than 5 and extremely annoying. You can do them the normal way and risk wasting your time, or accept the raidcat as your raid savior.

>What's the meta?
4 Perrserkers. Their Hidden Ability stacks multiplicatively and, if you follow the flowchart, you can one-shot most raids.

>What's the raidcat like?
Perrserker @ Lum Berry
Level 100
Ability: Steely Spirit (Hidden Ability)
EVs: 252 Atk / 252 Speed (Host) or HP (Joiner)
Adamant Nature
- Iron Head
- Screech
- Swords Dance
- Taunt (Host) / Helping Hand (Joiner)

>Host? Joiner? Flowchart?
There's a small difference in strategy whether you are hosting or joining a raid and a specific flowchart. See OP pic.

>Does this work every time?
No, but it's one of the only consistent strategies that you can follow. It's not great against Pokemon that have strong and/or STAB Fire/Fighting/Ground moves, and if their Tera resists Steel it can also take a few more turn (but still doable).

>So what's the hype?
Catraids are simple to organize, have plenty of flowcharts, and finish the job very quickly. It's about efficiency.

>I have a question about raids...
Check OP pic.

>How to get cat with HA?
Language Teacher sidequest, then use an Ability Patch to change its ability. Patch is an 11% drop from 6 Star Raids.

>I tried breeding but I'm getting Kantonian Meowth
Make the G-Meowth hold an Everstone

>wtf I did that but none of them have Steely Spirit
G-Meowth's HA is Unnerve, it becomes Steely Spirit upon evolution.

For other viable meta strategies and mons, Ctrl+F OTHERMONS

For specific strategies, Ctrl+F HARDRAIDS

Use this thread to trade for raidcats, to organize (raidcat) raids, or just to discuss and ask questions about raids in general.

threads.name: Anonymous
threads.com:
I keep seeing threads from people failing tera raids, so I figured i should post a thread and maybe a couple people will spread the word from there.

Iron Hands @ Booster Energy
Adamant 252HP/252ATK
Drain Punch
Close Combat
Thunder Punch / High Horsepower / Heavy Slam
Belly Drum

Iron Hands is the single best solo raider in the game. He is insanely bulky, and with the boosted HP of raid bosses, in most situations he will always re-heal to full from a single Drain Punch. The AI will always defense buff turn 1 which makes solo raiding even easier. You would obviously have to use some judgement before attempting certain fairy type special attackers, but I have not failed a single 5*-6* tera raid with this Pokemon. In a lot of instances, he can 1 shot 5* bosses, or use a weaker attack to chip lifebar to finish the rest off with a Close Combat.
Build your own and stop relying on cat autism. You don't need to play online to clear raids and cat will fail against Zard anyways.
